metadata.title: CVE-2022-1048 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
A use-after-free flaw was found in the Linux kernelâ€™s sound subsystem inthe way a user triggers concurrent calls of PCM hw_params. The hw_freeioctls or similar race condition happens inside ALSA PCM for other ioctls.This flaw allows a local user to crash or potentially escalate theirprivileges on the system.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-1048` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.15.0-191-generic - 4.15.0-191.202~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-191-generic - 4.15.0-191.202~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-191-lowlatency - 4.15.0-191.202~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1139-aws - 4.15.0-1139.150~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro
